Summary: Silver cross-shaped object. Noticed after roaring sound. An arm extended 4-5 times with orange glow. Object appeared to shrink and disappear. 1 witness. 10-15 min. Time AM.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Randolph
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting details"j" was water superintendent for tabor, iowa. he was driving in his truck 10\17\1988 to the tabor wells which are 4 mi east of tabor. when he got there he noticed nothing. it was 7:10 am when he got back in his truck, engine off. he said he heard a roar for a few seconds and the sound was so loud it was like it was on top of him. he got out and looked up for a jet and noticed an object in the field to the se. he got back in his truck and watched the object. he said the roar caused no dust. it was just getting light and there were no stars out. the object was cross-shaped, 500-600 feet high and about 700-800 feet away. he could see it from underneath and said it was silver. he looked for lights but could see none. he was in his pickup with the window down and watched for 10-15 minutes trying to figure out what it was. he said a pencil erasure tip at arm's length would cover the object. he said an arm or point came out 4 or 5 times and when it did there was an orange glow (circular) around the object. there was no sound after the intial roar. he saw his son-in-law coming down the road and thought "i want him to see this". he was in a tractor with a cab. the object kept the same perspective to the witness as it moved away and seemed to get smaller and smaller. it shrank or moved out of sight in about 30 seconds, before the son-in-law got to the witness. the roar was earlier when the witness first saw the object. the son-in-law told the witness he saw or heard nothing. either before or after (he was not sure) his son-in-law got to him, he went back west to the top of a hill to see if he could again see the object. when he went back to the maintenance shop in town, tabor, the mayor and others were there. he told the mayor what he saw. the mayor said "don't tell anybody. they won't believe you". he only told a few people. i asked if there might be any traces in the field and he said it had been disked several times. i did not go to the area with the witness, but i had a good description. it was rainy and foggy when i was there. i learned about this report from jean sorenson who is a friend of jack's. i sent in a report earlier of a sighting she had. jack's wife wrote it down in her diary so we knew the date. also his son-in-law said the night before ufo coverup live was on tv. "j" said he didn't see the show. original report sent to ray boeche, mufon, 2\27\1989.
